wikipedia_page.main: Claude Moss Leigh (17 May 1888 – 19 January 1964) was a pioneer of social housing in the United Kingdom and the founder of MEPC plc, one of the United Kingdom's largest property companies.

response: The business was founded by Claude Moss Leigh in 1946 as the Metropolitan Estates & Property Corporation.Regen.net: Money List 2008 Having started as a property investment business it diversified into the development of shopping malls in the 1970s.General Growth to buy eight shopping centres from MEPC New York Times, 22 April 1998 It adopted the shortened name of MEPC in 1973. In 1987 it acquired the Oldham Estate.BT Pensioners buy Centrepoint BBC News, 1 June 2000
